revised_title: Observation and Analysis of Stacking Faults in Uranium Dioxide
tldr: The authors observed stacking faults and tetrahedra in uranium dioxide using transmission electron microscopy. They identified the displacement vector of the stacking faults and found that they are intrinsic. The tetrahedra are thought to be stacking faults on all four {111} planes, resulting from the dissociation of Frank sessile loops formed by vacancy condensation on {111} planes.
